{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3601013,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T04:35:47.532Z","cooked":"

With a new controller coming in 2027 being used by both FTC and FRC, we’re expecting that the number of python users will go up, especially with blockly generating python code (see the systemcore slides). Right now most RobotPy work is still primarily done by me – and even though I’m not very good at delegating, I’d like that to change!

There’s lots of room for contributions, especially if you’re a self-starter who wants to make an impact. Here’s some of the things that we need help with:

  • VSCode Extension - do you know typescript? Every year teams ask for RobotPy VSCode integration. I’d love to see a VSCode extension, but we need someone to make it happen.
  • Installer improvements - do you know python packaging? The robotpy-installer project has a lot of open usability improvement bugs that would be great for someone to work on. For the 2027 controller I expect that we’ll probably move to deploying to a virtualenv – how that will work is up in the air, and you could help define it.
  • Unit Testing - do you like breaking things on purpose? There are lots of tests in allwpilib, and very few tests in mostrobotpy. Everything probably works, but if you help us write tests we can catch more problems before they reach teams.
  • Robot Tests - do you know pytest? pyfrc has robot integration test support, and it’s better this year… but it also has flaws that need to be addressed. Take a look at the pyfrc github issue tracker.
  • Documentation - do you like writing? I don’t, and it shows.

Whenever I have ideas that I’d like to eventually get to for RobotPy, I try to put them on github. Take a look and see if there’s anything that seems interesting and make a pull request.

virtuald:

Documentation - do you like writing?

(Raises hand) Especially as SystemCore dates approach, I’d be happy to help here, if nothing else out of a sense of self preservation

My availability will be a bit up and down over the next 12 months or so, but if you find a larger bucket of work that needs thought about, feel free to @ me in an issue and I can start discussion of how to break it down and tackle it.

gerthworm:

(Raises hand) Especially as SystemCore dates approach, I’d be happy to help here, if nothing else out of a sense of self preservation

With documentation, there’s two large buckets of work:

  • Examples examples examples examples. There’s still lots of documentation pages that only have Java/C++ examples.
  • Installation documentation is fine, but there are still questions on CD about it so it can be better. Probably some improvement needed here, but what those improvements are is rather ill-defined.

How opposed to a PyCharm plugin are you? I am really unsure of how a VSCode extension would work in this case, at least similarly to WPILibs existing VSCode but a PyCharm one could be built similarly to @Javaru’s InteliJ plugin.

I think an eventual goal would be to integrate with the existing WPILib VSCode extension, so a vscode extension would probably have more impact?

I’m not opposed to a pycharm extension, but either way someone would need to do it.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T16:59:29.294Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500241,"topic_slug":"robotpy-looking-for-a-few-good-contributors","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601552,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T17:21:33.645Z","cooked":"
CakeDeer6:

I just graduated off a new-to-Python team and I’d love to start helping. Getting started seems pretty daunting. Any advice or anything I should know ahead of time?

Generally, you’ll be more productive if you’re doing something you find interesting and can put your head around. Trying to fix things that personally annoy you can be a good motivator too.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T17:21:33.645Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500241,"topic_slug":"robotpy-looking-for-a-few-good-contributors","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601598,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T17:57:43.883Z","cooked":"

To add onto this, we are planning on having vscode hosted on the controller in 2027 for on-controller development, so vscode extension support that provides command-line-free operation for creating and deploying Python robot code would be useful for both on-robot and desktop development use cases.
